### Music and media {#Music_and_media}

\[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Baku&action=edit&section=33 "Edit section: Music and media")\]
[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/42/Pht-Vugar_Ibadov_eurovision_%2831%29.jpg/220px-Pht-Vugar_Ibadov_eurovision_%2831%29.jpg)](/wiki/File:Pht-Vugar_Ibadov_eurovision_(31).jpg) [Baku Crystal Hall](/wiki/Baku_Crystal_Hall "Baku Crystal Hall") during the [Eurovision Song Contest 2012](/wiki/Eurovision_Song_Contest_2012 "Eurovision Song Contest 2012")  
Further information on (1916 to 1920): [The Hajibeyli Brothers' Opera-Operetta Artists' Troupe](/wiki/The_Hajibeyli_Brothers%27_Opera-Operetta_Artists%27_Troupe "The Hajibeyli Brothers' Opera-Operetta Artists' Troupe")

The music scene in Baku can be traced back to ancient times and villages of Baku, generally revered as the fountainhead of [meykhana](/wiki/Meykhana "Meykhana") and [mugham](/wiki/Mugham "Mugham") in the Azerbaijan.^[\[129\]](#cite_note-134)^^[\[130\]](#cite_note-135)^{#cite_ref-135}

Recently, the success of Azerbaijani performers such as [AySel](/wiki/Aysel_Teymurzadeh "Aysel Teymurzadeh"), [Farid Mammadov](/wiki/Farid_Mammadov "Farid Mammadov"), [Sabina Babayeva](/wiki/Sabina_Babayeva "Sabina Babayeva"), [Safura](/wiki/Safura_Alizadeh "Safura Alizadeh") and [Elnur Hüseynov](/wiki/Elnur_H%C3%BCseynov "Elnur Hüseynov") in the [Eurovision Song Contest](/wiki/Eurovision_Song_Contest "Eurovision Song Contest") has boosted the profile of Baku's music scene, prompting international attention. Following the victory of Azerbaijan's representative [Eldar \& Nigar](/wiki/Eldar_%26_Nigar "Eldar & Nigar") at the [Eurovision Song Contest 2011](/wiki/Eurovision_Song_Contest_2011 "Eurovision Song Contest 2011"), Baku hosted the [Eurovision Song Contest 2012](/wiki/Eurovision_Song_Contest_2012 "Eurovision Song Contest 2012").^[\[131\]](#cite_note-136)^^[\[132\]](#cite_note-137)^{#cite_ref-137}

2005 was a landmark in the development of [Azerbaijani jazz](/wiki/Azerbaijani_jazz "Azerbaijani jazz") in the city. It has been home to legendary jazz musicians like [Vagif Mustafazadeh](/wiki/Vagif_Mustafazadeh "Vagif Mustafazadeh"), [Aziza Mustafa Zadeh](/wiki/Aziza_Mustafa_Zadeh "Aziza Mustafa Zadeh"), Rafig Babayev and Rain Sultanov.^[\[133\]](#cite_note-138)^^[\[134\]](#cite_note-139)^ Among Baku's prominent annual fairs and festivals is [Baku International Jazz Festival](/wiki/Baku_International_Jazz_Festival "Baku International Jazz Festival"), which features some of the world's most identifiable jazz names.^[\[135\]](#cite_note-140)^^[\[136\]](#cite_note-141)^{#cite_ref-141}

Baku also has a thriving [International Centre of Mugham](/wiki/Mugham "Mugham"), which is located in [Baku Boulevard](/wiki/Baku_Boulevard "Baku Boulevard"), [Gulustan Palace](/wiki/Gulustan_Palace "Gulustan Palace") and [Buta Palace](/wiki/Buta_Palace "Buta Palace"), one of the principal [performing arts centres](/wiki/Performing_arts_centre "Performing arts centre") and [music venues](/wiki/Music_venue "Music venue") in the city.^[\[137\]](#cite_note-142)^{#cite_ref-142}

The majority of Azerbaijan's media companies (including television, newspaper and radio, such as, [Azad Azerbaijan TV](/wiki/Azad_Azerbaijan_TV "Azad Azerbaijan TV"), [Ictimai TV](/wiki/Ictimai_TV "Ictimai TV"), [Lider TV](/wiki/Lider_TV "Lider TV") and [Region TV](/wiki/Region_TV "Region TV")) are headquartered in Baku. The films *[The World Is Not Enough](/wiki/The_World_Is_Not_Enough "The World Is Not Enough")* and *[The Diamond Arm](/wiki/The_Diamond_Arm "The Diamond Arm")* , among [others](/wiki/List_of_films_shot_in_Baku "List of films shot in Baku"), are set in the city, while *[Amphibian Man](/wiki/Amphibian_Man_(film) "Amphibian Man (film)")* includes several scenes filmed in [Old City](/wiki/Old_City_(Baku) "Old City (Baku)").

The city's radio stations include: *Ictimai Radio* , *Radio Antenn* , *Burc FM* , *Avto FM* , [*ASAN Radio*](/wiki/ASANRadio "ASANRadio") and *Lider FM Jazz*

Some of Baku's newspapers include the daily *[Azadliq](/wiki/Azadliq_(newspaper) "Azadliq (newspaper)")* , *Zaman* (The Time), *Bakinskiy Rabochiy* (Baku Worker), *[Echo](/w/index.php?title=Echo_(Azerbaijani_newspaper)&action=edit&redlink=1 "Echo (Azerbaijani newspaper) (page does not exist)")* and the English-language *Baku Today*.

Baku is also featured in the video game *[Battlefield 4](/wiki/Battlefield_4 "Battlefield 4")* .^[\[138\]](#cite_note-143)^{#cite_ref-143}  

### Nightlife {#Nightlife}

\[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Baku&action=edit&section=34 "Edit section: Nightlife")\]

Many clubs that are open until dawn can be found throughout the city. Clubs with an eastern flavour provide special treats from the [cuisine of Azerbaijan](/wiki/Cuisine_of_Azerbaijan "Cuisine of Azerbaijan") along with local music. Western-style clubs target younger, more energetic crowds.^[\[139\]](#cite_note-144)^ Most of the [public houses](/wiki/Pub "Pub") and bars are located near [Fountains Square](/wiki/Fountains_Square,_Baku "Fountains Square, Baku") and are usually open until the early hours of the morning.{#cite_ref-144}  

### Parks and gardens {#Parks_and_gardens}

\[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Baku&action=edit&section=35 "Edit section: Parks and gardens")\]
[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ea/Panoramabild_Baku_Filarmonia_Park.JPG/350px-Panoramabild_Baku_Filarmonia_Park.JPG)](/wiki/File:Panoramabild_Baku_Filarmonia_Park.JPG) Philarmony garden

Baku has large sections of greenery, either preserved by the National Government or designated as green zones. The city, however, continues to lack a green belt development as economic activity pours into the capital, resulting in massive housing projects along the suburbs.^[\[140\]](#cite_note-145)^{#cite_ref-145}

[Baku Boulevard](/wiki/Baku_Boulevard "Baku Boulevard") is a pedestrian promenade that runs parallel to Baku's seafront. The boulevard contains an amusement park, [yacht club](/wiki/Yacht_club "Yacht club"), [musical fountain](/wiki/Musical_fountain "Musical fountain"), statues and monuments. The park is popular with dog-walkers and joggers and is convenient for tourists. It is adjacent to the newly built [International Centre of Mugham](/w/index.php?title=International_Mugam_Centre_of_Azerbaijan&action=edit&redlink=1 "International Mugam Centre of Azerbaijan (page does not exist)") and the musical fountain.

Other parks and gardens include Heydar Aliyev Park, Samad Vurgun Park, Narimanov Park, [Alley of Honor](/wiki/Alley_of_Honor "Alley of Honor") and the [Fountains Square](/wiki/Fountains_Square,_Baku "Fountains Square, Baku"). The [Martyrs' Lane](/wiki/Martyrs%27_Lane "Martyrs' Lane"), formerly the Kirov Park, is dedicated to the memory of those who died during the [Nagorno-Karabakh conflict](/wiki/Nagorno-Karabakh_conflict "Nagorno-Karabakh conflict") and also to the 137 people killed on [Black January](/wiki/Black_January "Black January").  

Sports {#Sports}
----------------

\[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Baku&action=edit&section=36 "Edit section: Sports")\]
[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/31/Ilham_Aliyev_watched_the_opening_ceremony_of_the_2018_Formula-1_Azerbaijan_Grand_Prix_and_final_race_32.jpg/220px-Ilham_Aliyev_watched_the_opening_ceremony_of_the_2018_Formula-1_Azerbaijan_Grand_Prix_and_final_race_32.jpg)](/wiki/File:Ilham_Aliyev_watched_the_opening_ceremony_of_the_2018_Formula-1_Azerbaijan_Grand_Prix_and_final_race_32.jpg) [2018 Azerbaijan Grand Prix](/wiki/2018_Azerbaijan_Grand_Prix "2018 Azerbaijan Grand Prix") [![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e8/Chelsea_won_UEFA_Europa_League_final_at_Olympic_Stadium_and_President_Ilham_Aliyev_watched_the_final_match_15.jpg/220px-Chelsea_won_UEFA_Europa_League_final_at_Olympic_Stadium_and_President_Ilham_Aliyev_watched_the_final_match_15.jpg)](/wiki/File:Chelsea_won_UEFA_Europa_League_final_at_Olympic_Stadium_and_President_Ilham_Aliyev_watched_the_final_match_15.jpg) [Chelsea](/wiki/Chelsea_F.C. "Chelsea F.C.") playing against [Arsenal](/wiki/Arsenal_F.C. "Arsenal F.C.") at [Baku Olympic Stadium](/wiki/Baku_Olympic_Stadium "Baku Olympic Stadium") during the [2019 UEFA Europa League Final](/wiki/2019_UEFA_Europa_League_Final "2019 UEFA Europa League Final")

Baku hosts a [Formula One](/wiki/Formula_One "Formula One") race on the [Baku City Circuit](/wiki/Baku_City_Circuit "Baku City Circuit"). The first was the [2016 European Grand Prix](/wiki/2016_European_Grand_Prix "2016 European Grand Prix"), with the track going around the old city. The track measures 6.003 km (3.730 mi), and it has been on the Formula One calendar since its 2016 debut.

The city also hosted three group games and one quarter-final of the [UEFA Euro 2020](/wiki/UEFA_Euro_2020 "UEFA Euro 2020") European Football Championship.^[\[141\]](#cite_note-146)^{#cite_ref-146}

Since 2002, Baku has hosted 36 major sporting events and selected to host the [2015 European Games](/wiki/2015_European_Games "2015 European Games").^[\[142\]](#cite_note-147)^ Baku is also to host the [fourth edition](/wiki/2017_Islamic_Solidarity_Games "2017 Islamic Solidarity Games") of the [Islamic Solidarity Games](/wiki/Islamic_Solidarity_Games "Islamic Solidarity Games") in 2017.{#cite_ref-147}

Baku is also one of world's leading chess centres, having produced [grandmasters](/wiki/Grandmaster_(chess) "Grandmaster (chess)") like [Teimour Radjabov](/wiki/Teimour_Radjabov "Teimour Radjabov"), [Vugar Gashimov](/wiki/Vugar_Gashimov "Vugar Gashimov"), [Garry Kasparov](/wiki/Garry_Kasparov "Garry Kasparov"), [Shahriyar Mammadyarov](/wiki/Shahriyar_Mammadyarov "Shahriyar Mammadyarov") and [Rauf Mammadov](/wiki/Rauf_Mammadov "Rauf Mammadov"), as well as the arbiter [Faik Hasanov](/wiki/Faik_Hasanov "Faik Hasanov"). The city also annually hosts the international tournaments such as Baku Chess Grand Prix, President's Cup, Baku Open and bidding to host [42nd Chess Olympiad](/wiki/42nd_Chess_Olympiad "42nd Chess Olympiad") in 2014.^[\[143\]](#cite_note-148)^^[\[144\]](#cite_note-149)^{#cite_ref-149}

First class sporting facilities were built for the indoor games, including the Palace of Hand Games and [Heydar Aliyev Sports and Exhibition Complex](/wiki/Heydar_Aliyev_Sports_and_Exhibition_Complex "Heydar Aliyev Sports and Exhibition Complex"). It hosted many sporting events, including [FIFA U-17 Women's World Cup](/wiki/FIFA_U-17_Women%27s_World_Cup "FIFA U-17 Women's World Cup"), [Rhythmic Gymnastics European Championships](/wiki/Rhythmic_Gymnastics_European_Championships "Rhythmic Gymnastics European Championships") in [2007](/wiki/2007_Rhythmic_Gymnastics_European_Championships "2007 Rhythmic Gymnastics European Championships") and [2009](/wiki/2009_Rhythmic_Gymnastics_European_Championships "2009 Rhythmic Gymnastics European Championships"), [2005 World Rhythmic Gymnastics Championships](/wiki/2005_World_Rhythmic_Gymnastics_Championships "2005 World Rhythmic Gymnastics Championships"), [2007 FILA Wrestling World Championships](/wiki/2007_FILA_Wrestling_World_Championships "2007 FILA Wrestling World Championships") and [2010 European Wrestling Championships](/wiki/2010_European_Wrestling_Championships "2010 European Wrestling Championships"), [2011 World Amateur Boxing Championships](/wiki/2011_World_Amateur_Boxing_Championships "2011 World Amateur Boxing Championships"), [2009 Women's Challenge Cup](/wiki/Women%27s_Challenge_Cup_(volleyball) "Women's Challenge Cup (volleyball)") and [European Taekwondo Championships](/wiki/European_Taekwondo_Championships "European Taekwondo Championships") in 2007.^[\[145\]](#cite_note-150)^^[\[146\]](#cite_note-151)^ Since 2011 the city annually hosts [WTA](/wiki/Women%27s_Tennis_Association "Women's Tennis Association") tennis event called [Baku Cup](/wiki/Baku_Cup "Baku Cup").^[\[147\]](#cite_note-152)^{#cite_ref-152}

The [Synergy Baku Cycling Project](/wiki/Synergy_Baku_Cycling_Project "Synergy Baku Cycling Project") participates in the [Tour d'Azerbaïdjan](/wiki/Tour_d%27Azerba%C3%AFdjan "Tour d'Azerbaïdjan") a 2.2 multi-stage bicycle race on the UCI Europe Tour.

Baku made a bid to host the [2016 Summer Olympics](/wiki/Baku_bid_for_the_2016_Summer_Olympics "Baku bid for the 2016 Summer Olympics") and [2020 Summer Olympics](/wiki/Baku_bid_for_the_2020_Summer_Olympics "Baku bid for the 2020 Summer Olympics"),^[\[148\]](#cite_note-153)^ but failed to become a Candidate City both times.^[\[149\]](#cite_note-154)^{#cite_ref-154}

The largest sports hub in the city is [Baku Olympic Stadium](/wiki/Baku_Olympic_Stadium "Baku Olympic Stadium") with 69,870 seating capacity, whose construction was completed in 2015. [UEFA Europa League Final 2019](/wiki/2019_UEFA_Europa_League_final "2019 UEFA Europa League final") was played at the [Olympic Stadium](/wiki/Baku_Olympic_Stadium "Baku Olympic Stadium") in Baku on 29 May 2019 between [English](/wiki/The_Football_Association "The Football Association") sides [Chelsea](/wiki/Chelsea_F.C. "Chelsea F.C.") and [Arsenal](/wiki/Arsenal_F.C. "Arsenal F.C.").^[\[150\]](#cite_note-155)^ The city's main football clubs is [Neftçi Baku](/wiki/Neftchi_Baku_PFK "Neftchi Baku PFK") of who first has nine Premier League titles, making Neftchi the most successful Azerbaijani football club. Baku also has several football clubs in the premier and regional leagues, including [AZAL](/wiki/AZAL_PFK "AZAL PFK") and [Ravan](/wiki/Ravan_Baku_FK "Ravan Baku FK") in [Premier League](/wiki/Azerbaijan_Premier_League "Azerbaijan Premier League"). The city's second-largest stadium, [Tofiq Bahramov Stadium](/wiki/Tofiq_Bahramov_Stadium "Tofiq Bahramov Stadium") hosts a number of domestic and international competitions and was the main sports centre of the city for a long period until the construction of Baku Olympic Stadium.{#cite_ref-155}

In the [Azerbaijan Women's Volleyball Super League](/wiki/Azerbaijan_Women%27s_Volleyball_Super_League "Azerbaijan Women's Volleyball Super League"), Baku is represented by [Rabita Baku](/wiki/Rabita_Baku "Rabita Baku"), [Azerrail Baku](/wiki/Azerrail_Baku "Azerrail Baku"), [Lokomotiv Baku](/wiki/Lokomotiv_Baku "Lokomotiv Baku") and [Azeryol Baku](/wiki/Azeryol_Baku "Azeryol Baku").  

Transport {#Transport}
----------------------

\[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Baku&action=edit&section=37 "Edit section: Transport")\]
[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cd/Bakutaxi.jpg/220px-Bakutaxi.jpg)](/wiki/File:Bakutaxi.jpg) Baku black cab, introduced in 2011 [![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0a/Avtova%C4%9Fzal_stansiyas%C4%B1_1.jpg/220px-Avtova%C4%9Fzal_stansiyas%C4%B1_1.jpg)](/wiki/File:Avtova%C4%9Fzal_stansiyas%C4%B1_1.jpg) Baku Metro

Throughout history, the transport system of Baku used the now-defunct [horsecars](/wiki/Horsecar "Horsecar"), trams and [narrow gauge railways](/wiki/Narrow_gauge_railways "Narrow gauge railways"). As of 2011^[\[update\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Baku&action=edit)^, 1,000 [black cabs](/wiki/Hackney_carriage "Hackney carriage") are ordered by Baku Taxi Company, and as part of a programme originally announced by the Transport Ministry of Azerbaijan, there is a plan to introduce London cabs into Baku.^[\[151\]](#cite_note-156)^^[\[152\]](#cite_note-157)^ The move was part of £16 million agreement between [Manganese Bronze](/wiki/Manganese_Bronze "Manganese Bronze") subsidiary [LTI Limited](/wiki/London_Taxis_International "London Taxis International") and Baku Taxi Company.^[\[153\]](#cite_note-158)^^[\[154\]](#cite_note-159)^{#cite_ref-159}

Local rail transport includes the [Baku Funicular](/wiki/Baku_Funicular "Baku Funicular") and the [Baku Metro](/wiki/Baku_Metro "Baku Metro"), a rapid-transit system notable for its art, murals, mosaics and ornate chandeliers. Baku Metro was opened in November 1967 and includes 3 lines and 25 stations at present; 170 million people used Baku Metro over the past five years.^[\[155\]](#cite_note-160)^ In 2008, the Chief of Baku Metro, Taghi Ahmadov, announced plans to construct 41 new stations over the next 17 years. These will serve the new [bus complex](/wiki/Baku_International_Bus_Terminal "Baku International Bus Terminal") as well as the international airport.^[\[156\]](#cite_note-161)^ In 2019, the [Baku suburban railway](/wiki/Baku_suburban_railway "Baku suburban railway") opened.{#cite_ref-161}

[BakuCard](/wiki/BakuCard "BakuCard") is a single Smart Card for payment on all types of city transport. The intercity buses and metro use this type of card-based fare-payment system.^[\[157\]](#cite_note-162)^^[\[158\]](#cite_note-163)^{#cite_ref-163}

[Baku Railway Station](/wiki/Baku_Railway_Station "Baku Railway Station") is the terminus for national and international rail links to the city. The [Kars--Tbilisi--Baku railway](/wiki/Kars%E2%80%93Tbilisi%E2%80%93Baku_railway "Kars–Tbilisi–Baku railway"), which directly connects Turkey, Georgia and [Azerbaijan](/wiki/Azerbaijan "Azerbaijan"), began to be constructed in 2007 and opened in 2017.^[\[159\]](#cite_note-164)^ The completed branch will connect Baku with [Tbilisi](/wiki/Tbilisi "Tbilisi") in Georgia, and from there trains will continue to [Akhalkalaki](/wiki/Akhalkalaki "Akhalkalaki"), and [Kars](/wiki/Kars "Kars") in Turkey.^[\[160\]](#cite_note-165)^{#cite_ref-165}
[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/da/Baku_Funicular_station.jpg/220px-Baku_Funicular_station.jpg)](/wiki/File:Baku_Funicular_station.jpg) [Baku Funicular](/wiki/Baku_Funicular "Baku Funicular")

Sea transport is vital for Baku, as the city is practically surrounded by the [Caspian Sea](/wiki/Caspian_Sea "Caspian Sea") to the east. Shipping services operate regularly from Baku across the Caspian Sea to [Turkmenbashi](/wiki/T%C3%BCrkmenba%C5%9Fy,_Turkmenistan "Türkmenbaşy, Turkmenistan") (formerly Krasnovodsk) in [Turkmenistan](/wiki/Turkmenistan "Turkmenistan") and to [Bandar Anzali](/wiki/Bandar-e_Anzali "Bandar-e Anzali") and [Bandar Nowshar](/wiki/Nowshahr "Nowshahr") in Iran.^[\[161\]](#cite_note-166)^ The commuter ferries, along with the high-speed catamaran *Seabus* (*Deniz Avtobusu* ), also form the main connection between the city and the [Absheron peninsula](/wiki/Absheron_peninsula "Absheron peninsula").^[\[162\]](#cite_note-167)^{#cite_ref-167}

Baku Port was founded in 1902 and claims to be the largest Caspian Sea port. It has six facilities: the main cargo terminal, the container terminal, the ferry terminal, the oil terminal, the passenger terminal and the port fleet terminal. The port's throughput capacity reaches 15 million [tonnes](/wiki/Tonnes "Tonnes") of liquid bulk and up to 10 million tons of dry cargoes.^[\[163\]](#cite_note-168)^ In 2010, the [Baku International Sea Trade Port](/wiki/Baku_International_Sea_Trade_Port "Baku International Sea Trade Port") began to be reconstructed. The construction was planned to take place in three stages and to be completed by 2016. The estimated costs were US$400 million.^[\[164\]](#cite_note-169)^ From April to November, Baku Port is accessible to ships loading cargoes for direct voyages from Western European and Mediterranean ports. The State Road M-1 and the [European route E60](/wiki/European_route_E60 "European route E60") are the two main motorway connections between Europe and Azerbaijan. The motorway network around Baku is well-developed and is constantly being extended.{#cite_ref-169}

The [Heydar Aliyev International Airport](/wiki/Heydar_Aliyev_International_Airport "Heydar Aliyev International Airport") is the only commercial airport serving Baku. The new [Baku Cargo Terminal](/wiki/Baku_Cargo_Terminal "Baku Cargo Terminal") was officially opened in March 2005. It was constructed to be a major cargo hub in the [CIS](/wiki/Commonwealth_of_Independent_States "Commonwealth of Independent States") countries, and is actually now one of the biggest and most technically advanced in the region.^[\[165\]](#cite_note-170)^^\[*[unreliable source?](/wiki/Wikipedia:Reliable_sources "Wikipedia:Reliable sources")*\]^ There are also several smaller [military airbases](/wiki/Military_airbase "Military airbase") near Baku, such as [Baku Kala Air Base](/wiki/Baku_Kala_Air_Base "Baku Kala Air Base"), intended for private aircraft, [helicopters](/wiki/Helicopter "Helicopter") and charters.^[\[166\]](#cite_note-171)^{#cite_ref-171}

Health care {#Health_care}
--------------------------

\[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Baku&action=edit&section=40 "Edit section: Health care")\]

According to the Ministry of Healthcare, healthcare facilities in Baku are "highly developed compared with the regions and doctors are waiting to work there. The regions, meanwhile, lack both doctors and clinics providing specialized medical treatment." Resulting in citizens travelling for many hours to Baku to receive adequate medical treatment.^[\[167\]](#cite_note-172)^{#cite_ref-172}

International relations {#International_relations}
